ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] How are people getting the white scales?
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve never had an opportunity to go on a Vox raid. Perm is so far out of the way it s a major effort for a small guild like mine to sponsor a raid. Any
ygData.messageBody:
I've never had an opportunity to go on a Vox raid. Perm is so far out of
the way it's a major effort for a small guild like mine to sponsor a raid.
Any organizing is especially hard since I play late hours PST when the
Xegony pop drops to under 1500 or even 1000.

And last time I participated in a Naggy raid no scales dropped :(.

In summary, I'm seriously thinking of moving on and getting back into some
XP grouping. And now that charm is nerfed I want twilight so I can again
be a CC asset.

Too bad we don't have a voting tool on this list. Would be interesting to
see how many people think it's still worth it to wait around.

Tzeetch "prob losing chance for Naggy drums" Minstrel
Xegony

Matt DeBarger wrote: Assuming the raid leader know what he/she is doing
there is no reason for aVox/Naggy raid to fail. The melee damage output
with kunark/sov weapons isso much higher than what those 2 were tuned for.
Not to mention these raidsoften have access to high level buffsThe
problem (at least on the raids I went to) is that the munchkin mob hashad
enough time to get to 50 now. Obviously there were lvl 50 idiots
prekunark, but they were less and often easily identifible (from what I
washearing at that time). Now they have Sebillis keys.When I went on my
first Vox raid, I sat there silently, in terror that Iwould screw
something up. I turned off guild chat and told all my friendsto not send
me tells. I asked this list and the high level bards (I think Isent you a
tell Sartori, hehehe) what I should be doing.I am not talking about a
young guild/ coalition making an honest attempt atVox and failing here. I
admire people who try new (to them) things. I amtalking about a vetran
raid leader who can't get enough competent playerswho merely listen to him
to kill a old world dragon. I am talking peoplewho blantantly ignore the
directions given to them by the raid leader.Theres nothing hard about
understanding "DO NOT BUFF YOUR PARTY. NO ONESHOULD HAVE ANY BUFFSIF YOU
HAVE BUFFS, DISPEL THEM." Theres nothing hardabout "Do not send me tells
about loot, the looting rules were made publicbefore the raid and will be
repeated before we make groups." There isnothing hard about "Do not move
past me, if you fall in a pit or agro a mob,especially Vox, do not try to
run, just stand there and die, we will rezyou."/rant offElfson Allegro 55
